conclusion: Analyze current positions of objects and shadows to predict new shadow positions based on light source location.
Shadow A is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow B is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow C is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Shadow D is cast to the right and slightly forward.
Light source moves from directly above to back left, positioned behind and to the left of objects.
When light source is directly above, shadows are cast straight down.
As light source moves to back left, shadows will be cast more towards left and slightly behind objects.
Shadow A will move to the left and slightly behind the object.
Shadow B will move to the left and slightly behind the object.
Shadow C will move to the left and slightly behind the object.
Shadow D will move to the left and slightly behind the object.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left and slightly behind the respective objects.
